reg_pit.acttitle: Child, Family and Community Service Act
reg_pit.title: Child, Family and Community Service Regulation

change.changenote: Section 4 (4) was added by BC Reg 82/2014, effective June 1, 2014.
Section 4 (3) (a.1) was added by BC Reg 187/2018, effective October 1, 2018.
Section 7 (2) (h) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 17/2019, effective April 1, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the child is an aboriginal child, the steps to be taken to preserve the child's aboriginal identity.

change.changenote: Section 8 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 274/2012, effective February 1, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: In this section, plan of care means a plan of care prepared for any court hearing other than a presentation hearing.

change.changenote: Section 8 (2) (j) and (l) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 274/2012, effective February 1, 2013.

paragraph.paragraphtext: a description of the services to be provided to the parent as agreed to by the parent;
the goals of the services to be provided to the parent and the child and the method of determining if they have been met;

change.changenote: Section 8 (2) (g), (i) and (n) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 17/2019, effective April 1, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an aboriginal child other than a treaty first nation child or a Nisg̱a'a child, the name of the child's Indian band or aboriginal community, in the case of a treaty first nation child, the name of the child's treaty first nation and, in the case of a Nisg̱a'a child, the Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government;

in the case of an aboriginal child other than a treaty first nation child or a Nisg̱a'a child, the involvement of the child's Indian band or aboriginal community, in the case of a treaty first nation child, the involvement of the child's treaty first nation and, in the case of a Nisg̱a'a child, the involvement of the Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government, in the development of the plan of care, including its views, if any, on the plan;
in the case of an aboriginal child, the steps to be taken to preserve the child's cultural identity and to comply with section 71 (3) of the Act;

change.changenote: Section 8.01 was enacted by BC Reg 274/2012, effective February 1, 2013.
Section 8.01 (3) was added by BC Reg 82/2014, effective June 1, 2014.
Section 8.01 (2) (i) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 17/2019, effective April 1, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an aboriginal child, the steps to be taken to preserve the child's cultural identity;

bcl:part.bcl:text: Agreements with Youths and Young Adults

change.changenote: Section 8.2 (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 17/2019, effective April 1, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an aboriginal youth, information necessary to support and preserve the youth's aboriginal identity;

change.changenote: Section 8.3 was enacted by BC Reg 240/2016, effective October 17, 2016.
Section 8.4 was enacted by BC Reg 240/2016, effective October 17, 2016.
Section 8.4 (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 20/2018, effective April 1, 2018.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: no agreement may extend beyond the person's 26th birthday.

change.changenote: Section 8.4 (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 82/2023, effective March 30, 2023.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the total of the terms of all the agreements, including renewals of the agreements, must not exceed 48 months, and

change.changenote: Section 8.5 was enacted by BC Reg 95/2020, effective May 4, 2020.
Section 8.5 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 82/2023, effective March 30, 2023.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The running of the 48-month period set out in section 8.4 (a) is suspended, in relation to an eligible person, during the suspension period if a director is satisfied of either of the following:

change.changenote: Part 4 title BEFORE amended by BC Reg 17/2019, effective April 1, 2019.
Section 10.1 was enacted by BC Reg 17/2019, effective April 1, 2019.
Section 11 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 17/2019, effective April 1, 2019.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of informing them under section 33.1 (4) (c), 34 (3) (d), 36 (2.1) (e) or 42.1 (3) (c) of the Act about presentation hearings,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the aboriginal organizations listed in column 2 of Schedule 1 are prescribed for cases involving aboriginal children who are registered or entitled to be registered as members of the Indian bands listed opposite in column 1, and
the aboriginal organizations listed in column 2 of Schedule 2 are prescribed for cases involving aboriginal children, other than those referred to in paragraph (a),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: who are 12 years of age or over and have identified any of the aboriginal communities listed opposite in column 1, or
who are under 12 years of age and whose parents have identified any of the aboriginal communities listed opposite in column 1.

change.changenote: Section 12 (1), (2.1) and (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 17/2019, effective April 1, 2019.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The designated representative of an Indian band is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the band is named in Column 1 of Schedule 1, a person who holds a position listed opposite in Column 3;
if the band is not named in Column 1 of Schedule 1, a person who, for that band,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: holds the position of band manager,
holds a position of social development officer, or
if there is neither a band manager nor a social development officer for that band, holds an equivalent position.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The designated representative of a treaty first nation listed in Column 1 of Schedule 1B is a person who holds the position listed opposite in Column 2.
The designated representative of an aboriginal community listed in Column 1 of Schedule 2 is a person who holds a position listed opposite in Column 3.

change.changenote: Part 4.1 and section 12.1 were enacted by BC Reg 17/2019, effective April 1, 2019.
Section 14 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 57/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: Wherever practicable, a person who was involved in the matter under review must not be designated as a review authority for that matter.

change.changenote: Section 15 (0.1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 57/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: In this section, Child and Youth Officer means the child and youth officer appointed under section 2 of the Office for Children and Youth Act.

change.changenote: Section 15 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 57/2012, effective October 1, 2012.
change.amennote: [BC Reg 57/2012 was amended by BC Reg 273/2012.]

subsection.subsectiontext: Any of the following may, at any time, request an administrative review of any decision, act or failure to act of a director, that relates to the provision of service to a child or family under Part 2, 2.1, 3 or 4 of the Act:

paragraph.paragraphtext: any person representing a child or parent.

change.changenote: Section 15 (2) (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 57/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: must be made to the director concerned, and

change.changenote: Section 15 (3) (c) and (d) were added by BC Reg 273/2012, effective September 26, 2012.
Section 16 (1) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 57/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: the child or family does not want it to proceed with the review,

change.changenote: Section 17 (1) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 57/2012, effective October 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: must complete the review within 30 days after the request is made, unless it decides under section 16 not to proceed with the review.

change.changenote: Section 17 (2) (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 57/2012, effective October 1, 2012.
Section 17 (2) (a.1) was added by BC Reg 57/2012, effective October 1, 2012.
Section 19 (2) (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 57/2012, effective October 1, 2012.
change.amennote: [BC Reg 57/2012 was amended by BC Reg 273/2012.]

paragraph.paragraphtext: the child or other person who requested the review,

change.changenote: Section 19 (2) (a.1) and (a.2) were added by BC Reg 57/2012, effective October 1, 2012.
Section 25 (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 17/2019, effective April 1, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an aboriginal child,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the child is registered or entitled to be registered as a member of an Indian band, a representative of that band,
if the child is a Nisg̱a'a child, a representative of the Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government,
if the child is a treaty first nation child, a representative of the treaty first nation, and

bcl:clause.bcl:text: if the child is 12 years of age or older, a representative of an aboriginal community identified by the child, or
if the child is under 12 years of age, a representative of an aboriginal community identified by the parents of the child;

change.changenote: Schedule 3 part of Form A BEFORE amended by BC Reg 53/2011, effective April 1, 2011.

schedule.lefttext: If the child/ren is/are aboriginal, the following are the name(s) of each child and the name(s) of each child's aboriginal community or the band that the child is registered or entitled to be registered as a member of or whether the child is a Nisga'a child of the Nisga'a Nation:

tablecol.strong: Community or band name or Nisga'a Nation:

change.changenote: Schedule 3, Form A BEFORE amended by BC Reg 82/2014, effective June 1, 2014.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: I, .................................................., as a delegate of the director under section 92 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act, present this written report to the court.
The child/ren listed below is/are under the age of nineteen years, and is/are the subject of this report:
The following is/are the parent(s) of the child/ren:
If the child/ren is/are aboriginal, the following are the name(s) of each child and
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: (a) the name of the Indian band of which the child is a registered member or is or entitled to be a registered member,
(b) the name of the treaty first nation of which the child is a treaty first nation child,
(c) the name of the child's aboriginal community, or
(d) if the child is a Nisg̱a'a child, the Nisg̱a'a Nation.

oasis:line.in:strong:
Indian band, treaty first nation or aboriginal
community name or Nisg̱a'a Nation:

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: The child/ren was/were removed on the following date and at the following location:

By and in the presence of:
(first list the person removing the child/ren and then any other person(s) present at the time of the removal)
The circumstances that caused the director to remove the child(ren) are as follows:
The child/ren was/were removed in accordance with the following:
[ ] section 30 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act in the following circumstance(s) as described by section 13 of the Act:
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: (a) [ ] the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed by the child's parent
(b) [ ] the child has been, or is likely to be, sexually abused or exploited by the child's parent
(c) [ ] the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed, sexually abused or sexually exploited by another person and the child's parent is unwilling or unable to protect the child
(d) [ ] the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed because of neglect by the child's parent
(e) [ ] the child is emotionally harmed by the parent's conduct
(f) [ ] the child is deprived of necessary health care
(g) [ ] the child's development is likely to be seriously impaired by a treatable condition and the child's parent refuses to provide or consent to treatment
(h) [ ] the child's parent is unable or unwilling to care for the child and has not made adequate provision for the child's care
(i) [ ] the child is or has been absent from home in circumstances that endanger the child's safety or well-being
(j) [ ] the child's parent is dead and adequate provision has not been made for the child's care
(k) [ ] the child has been abandoned and adequate provision has not been made for the child's care
(l) [ ] the child is in the care of a director or another person by agreement and the child's parent is unwilling or unable to resume care when the agreement is no longer in force
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: [ ] section 36 (1) of the Act, which requires a director to remove the child if the director has reasonable grounds to believe that either or both of the following apply:
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: (i) an order made under section 33.2, 35 (2) (b) or (d) or 36 (3) of the Act no longer protects the child;

(ii) a person has not complied with a term or condition of an order under section 33.2, 35 (2) (b) or (d) or 36 (3) of the Act and a director is required by that order to remove the child in the event of non-compliance.
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: [ ] section 42 (1) of the Act, which requires a director to remove the child if the director has reasonable grounds to believe that either or both of the following apply:
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: (i) that a supervision order made under section 41 (1) (a) or (b), (1.1) or (2.1), 42.2 (4) (a) or (c), 46 (3) or 49 (8) of the Act or an interim order made under section 42.1 of the Act no longer protects the child;
(ii) a person has not complied with a term or condition of the supervision or interim order and a director is required by that order to remove the child in the event of non-compliance.
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: If the child/ren was/were removed under section 30, the following less disruptive measures were considered by the director before removing the child/ren:
The child/ren's current living arrangement is as follows:
Steps taken to preserve the child/ren's aboriginal identity/identities are:
[ ] not applicable
[ ] as follows:
The child/ren's views on the interim plan of care:
[ ] have been considered
[ ] have not been considered
The parent
[ ] has
[ ] has not
been involved in the development of the plan.

bcl:lefttext.in:strong: Director's Recommendations About Care and Supervision and Access

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: The director recommends the following with regard to care and supervision of the child/ren and access by any person to the child/ren:

[ ] section 33 (1.1) of the Child, Family and Community Service Act

The director has returned the child/ren for the following reason(s):

bcl:lefttext.in:strong: Statutory Authority for Removal of Child/ren Returned under s. 33

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: If the child/ren has/have been returned under s. 33, the child/ren was/were removed in accordance with the following:
[ ] section 30 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act in the following circumstance(s) as described by section 13 of the Act:
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: (a) [ ] the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed by the child's parent
(b) [ ] the child has been, or is likely to be, sexually abused or exploited by the child's parent
(c) [ ] the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed, sexually abused or sexually exploited by another person and the child's parent is unwilling or unable to protect the child
(d) [ ] the child has been, or is likely to be, physically harmed because of neglect by the child's parent
(e) [ ] the child is emotionally harmed by the parent's conduct
(f) [ ] the child is deprived of necessary health care
(g) [ ] the child's development is likely to be seriously impaired by a treatable condition and the child's parent refuses to provide or consent to treatment
(h) [ ] the child's parent is unable or unwilling to care for the child and has not made adequate provision for the child's care
(i) [ ] the child is or has been absent from home in circumstances that endanger the child's safety or well-being
(j) [ ] the child's parent is dead and adequate provision has not been made for the child's care
(k) [ ] the child has been abandoned and adequate provision has not been made for the child's care
(l) [ ] the child is in the care of a director or another person by agreement and the child's parent is unwilling or unable to resume care when the agreement is no longer in force
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: [ ] section 36 (1) of the Act, which requires a director to remove the child if the director has reasonable grounds to believe that either or both of the following apply:
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: (i) an order made under section 33.2, 35 (2) (b) or (d) or 36 (3) of the Act no longer protects the child;

(ii) a person has not complied with a term or condition of an order under section 33.2, 35 (2) (b) or (d) or 36 (3) of the Act and a director is required by that order to remove the child in the event of non-compliance.
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: [ ] section 42 (1) of the Act, which requires a director to remove the child if the director has reasonable grounds to believe that either or both of the following apply:
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: (i) that a supervision order made under section 41 (1) (a) or (b), (1.1) or (2.1), 42.2 (4) (a) or (c), 46 (3) or 49 (8) of the Act or an interim order made under section 42.1 of the Act no longer protects the child;
(ii)a person has not complied with a term or condition of the supervision or interim order and a director is required by that order to remove the child in the event of non-compliance.
